column4: 64bit is so so much better faster, etc forget the fact its a pain in the ass to get anything to work! it rocks!
I haven't noticed any real increases in speed since I switched to 64-bit
that comment was in jest, and i completely disagree that its the way to go
of course it's what everyone should be using when everyone has a 64-bit processor
i disagree.. i've got 2 64bit PC's, use 32bit on both.
think about it, if everyone who could would use 64-bit OSs, then we'd have great drivers in a matter of weeks
but thats just not the reality of it, and i hate dealing w/ the constant issues of dealing w/ 64bit... whne its actually ready i'll use it.
it also depends on what you do on your computer, for me 64-bit works great except flash barely works
true...
i don't think he even knows.
yeah basically
well that should be an entertaining endeavor, you can try a network install, but at bare minimum, you're gonna need to download some files.
can the machine boot a usb device
yes it can
then i would probably get a cheap USB drive and put the image on there adn install from there.
well, you can't expect an image to just appear on the drive.. you have to have a way to put it there.
I already said I have a stick (1GB one) but it's at a friends place, I'm just trying to find a way to do this without having to leave my home:)
so what does a network boot do then?
well, you can give that oe up, you have to boot the image or get something on the hard drive to boot, before you can install.. common sense
its still gonna require a cd to my knowledge
why can't it get it over the network=
:D
